thread.title: Home and Away star Lynne McGranger talks about aging | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Home and Away star Lynne McGranger talks about aging | Daily Mail Online

author: Simone Amelia For Daily Mail Australia
title: Home and Away star Lynne McGranger talks about aging | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 70 shares 'Nor, conversely, do you want to look so fabulous that when people see you in real life they go, "What the hell",' she added. As the longest-running female cast member of the show, she argued her portrayal of Irene was suitable. Introspection: The 64-year-old opened up about how she doesn't let her 'ego in' when she stars in a live pantomime, but is more conscious of her looks on-screen 'I know I look older on screen and that’s okay, because it’s fitting with the character,' she explained. The Sydney-born actress admitted she has become fussy when it comes to working with the soap's hair and makeup department, putting it down to 'ego'. She conceded her physical appearance worried her more nowadays than when she started her career, having a more 'what the hell' approach back then. Particular: The Sydney-born actress admitted she has become fussy when it comes to working with the soap's hair and makeup department, putting it down to 'ego' Lynne, who also stars in British pantomimes each holiday season, said she feels she 'won the acting lottery' to have played the same character for over 23 years. The warm actress has championed many of the young Home and Away stars who've become Hollywood success stories. She once told NT News of Chris Hemsworth: 'He always had that star quality, it was plain to see, but he’s also talented and hardworking.' Self-conscious: She conceded her physical appearance worried her more nowadays than when she started her career, having a more 'what the hell' approach back then Read more:
